definition[0]: when someone tries to get money from you or make you do what they want by threatening to tell other people your secrets
definition[1]: when someone tries to make you do what they want by making threats or by making you feel guilty if you do not do it
example[0]: She had already tried emotional blackmail  (=tried to make him feel guilty) to stop him leaving.
example[1]: He was jailed for four years for blackmailing gay businessmen.
example[2]: I refuse to be blackmailed into making a quick decision.
definition[3]: demanding money from a person or organization by threatening them, for example threatening to tell secrets about them if they do not pay
example[3]: Most of his wealth had been acquired through blackmail.
definition[4]: to demand money from a person or organization by threatening them, for example threatening to tell secrets about them if they do not pay
example[4]: a man who blackmailed gay businessmen by threatening to expose their homosexuality
